poem:
Title: "In the Court of Choice"

Stone walls echo with silent plea,
Doctrines of life, on a bitter sea.
Across the wire, the decree lied,
In the shadow of Hippocratic pride,
A pill, a choice, the voices loom,
In the sterilized confines of each courtroom.
Unanimous, the gavel resounds,
In hearts of women, the judgement rebounds,
Yet this battle drawn, new or old,
Is but a tale, yet untold.
